slideInfo.mainText: Heroes often emerge in response to situations they never expected to encounter. In April 2011, tornadoes slammed Alabama, killing almost 300 people across the state. Survivors responded in one of two waysâ€”by helping those around them, or by taking advantage of a terrible situation. The vast majority of people pitched in to help their neighbors by sharing food and gasoline and finding medical supplies for those in need. In contrast, looters also immediately emerged, robbing local businesses in the midst of an unprecedented crisis. The common citizen was presented with an opportunity to be a hero, and the vast majority of those in Alabama proved their valor.
